TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UUEncoder extends System.Object implements class MimeKit.Encodings.IMimeEncoder

Docs.summary: Incrementally encodes content using the Unix-to-Unix encoding.

remarks.para: The UUEncoding is an encoding that predates MIME and was used to encode binary content such as images and other types of multi-media to ensure that the data remained intact when sent via 7bit transports such as SMTP.
These days, the UUEncoding has largely been deprecated in favour of the base64 encoding, however, some older mail clients still use it.

remarks.para: Encodes the specified input into the output buffer.
The output buffer should be large enough to hold all of the encoded input. For estimating the size needed for the output buffer, see .

Use the method to properly determine the necessary length of the byte array.
